entry.title: Compact quantum stabilizer subgroups
entry.summary: We generalize the concept of stabilizer subgroups to compact quantum groups.

entry.title: Sub-Riemannian metrics for quantum Heisenberg manifolds
entry.summary: Every Heisenberg manifold has a natural "sub-Riemannian" metric with interesting properties. We describe the corresponding noncommutative metric structure for Rieffel's quantum Heisenberg manifolds.

entry.title: Groupoid Approach to Quantum Projective Spaces
entry.summary: We show how the C*-algebras of quantum complex projective spaces (standard or nonstandard) are related to groupoids.

entry.title: Hilbert bimodules with involution
entry.summary: We examine Hilbert bimodules which possess a (generally unbounded) involution. Topics considered include a linking algebra representation, duality, locality, and the role of these bimodules in noncommutative differential geometry.

entry.title: Similarity problems and length
entry.summary: This is a survey of the author's recent results on the Kadison and Halmos similarity problems and the closely connected notion of ``length'' of an operator algebra.

entry.title: Maximal abelian subalgebras of O_n
entry.summary: We consider maximal abelian subalgebras of O_n which are invariant to the standard circle action.

entry.title: The McMillan theorem for a class of asymptotically abelian C*-algebras
entry.summary: An extension of the Shannon-McMillan-Breiman theorem to a class of non-commutative dynamical systems is given.

entry.title: The Baum-Connes conjecture for hyperbolic groups
entry.summary: We prove the Baum-Connes conjecture for hyperbolic groups and their subgroups.

entry.title: When Aut($\cal A$) and Homeo(Prim($\cal A$)) are homeomorphics
entry.summary: In this paper, we discuss when Aut($\cal A$) and Homeo(Prim($\cal A$)) are homeomorphic, where $\cal A$ is a $C^*$-algebra.

entry.title: Uniform Closure of Dual Banach Algebras
entry.summary: We give a characterization of the ''uniform closure'' of the dual of a $C^{*}$-algebra. Some applications in harmonic analysis are given.

entry.title: Notes on Operator Categories
entry.summary: The bicategory of normal functors between W*-categories is monoidally equivalent to the bicategory of W*-bimodules.

entry.title: Closed and sigma-finite measures on the orthogonal projections
entry.summary: We characterize the connection between closed and $\sigma$-finite measures on orthogonal projections of von Neumann algebras.

entry.title: Dimension and Entropy Computations for $L(F_r)$
entry.summary: We show that certain generating sets of Dykema and Radulescu for $L(F_r)$ have free Hausdorff dimension r and nondegenerate free Hausdorff r-entropy

entry.title: Topologically free partial actions and faithful representations of partial crossed products
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate the interrelation between the topological freedom of partial actions of discrete groups and faithful representations of partial crossed products.

entry.title: Multipliers between two operator spaces
entry.summary: In a recent survey paper we introduced one-sided multipliers between two different operator spaces. Here we give some basic theory for these maps.

entry.title: Ideals in Toeplitz Algebras
entry.summary: We determine the ideal structure of the Toeplitz C*-algebra on the bidisk.

entry.title: The Range of United K-Theory
entry.summary: We prove that united K-theory is a surjective functor from the category of real simple purely infinite C*-algebras to the cateogry of countable acyclic CRT-modules.

entry.title: A note on noncommutative holomorphic and harmonic functions on the unit disk
entry.summary: We study noncommutative versions of holomorphic and harmonic functions on the unit disk.

entry.title: When a C*-algebra is a coefficient algebra for a given endomorphism
entry.summary: The paper presents a criterion for a C*-algebra to be a coefficient algebra associated with a given endomorphism

entry.title: Projections in Graph W*-Algebras
entry.summary: In this paper, we will consider the projections in a graph W*-algebra.

entry.title: Notes on Free Probability Theory
entry.summary: These notes are from a 4-lecture mini-course taught by the author at the conference on von Neumann algebras as part of the ``Geometrie non commutative en mathematiques et physique'' month at CIRM in 2004.

entry.title: On cocycle actions of non-commutative Bernoulli shifts
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Injective Envelopes of Separable C*-algebras
entry.summary: Characterisations of those separable C*-algebras that have type I injective envelopes or W*-algebra injective envelopes are presented.

entry.title: Dynamical entropy of generalized quantum Markov chains on gauge invariant $C^*$-algebras
entry.summary: We prove that the mean entropy and the dynamical entropy are equal for generalized quantum Markov chains on gauge-invariant $C^*$-algebras.

entry.title: Landstad's characterization for full crossed products
entry.summary: Full C*-crossed products by actions of locally compact groups are characterized via the existence of suitable maximal coactions, in analogy with Landstad's characterization of reduced crossed products.

entry.title: Graph Free Product of Noncommutative Probability spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we will construct the graph free product of noncommutative probability space. This is the attempt to explain and observe the combinatorial-object-depending probabilistic structure.

entry.title: Simple C*-algebras with a unique tracial state
entry.summary: The oreginal paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Quasitraces need not be traces
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn. Some work upon which it is based has been found to contain an error

entry.title: The Calkin algebra has outer automorphisms
entry.summary: Assuming the continuum hypothesis, we show that the Calkin algebra has 2^{aleph_1} outer automorphisms.

entry.title: K-theory of some C*-algebras and buildings
entry.summary: We compute an exact formula for the order of the class of the identity in the K_0 group of an infinite class of two-dimensional Kuntz-Crieger algebras.

entry.title: Group Freeness and Certain Amalgamated Freeness
entry.summary: In this paper, we consider the relation between the group freeness and the amalgamated freeness of crossed product algebras.

entry.title: Dirichlet forms on hyperfinite II_1 factor
entry.summary: Based on the structure of the hyperfinite $II_1$ factor, we study its Dirichlet forms which can be obtained from Dirichlet forms on $M_{2^n}(\mathbb{C})$

entry.title: Rank-preserving module maps
entry.summary: In this paper, we characterize rank one preserving module maps on a Hilbert $C^\ast-$module and study its applications on free probability theory.

entry.title: Pseudodifferential operators and weighted normed symbol spaces
entry.summary: In this work we study some general classes of pseudodifferential operators whose symbols are defined in terms of phase space estimates.

entry.title: On Morita equivalence of group actions on locally C*-algebras
entry.summary: We extend to the context of locally C*-algebras a result of F. Combes [Proc. London Math. Soc. 49(1984), 289-306].

entry.title: Classification of outer actions of Z^N on O_2
entry.summary: We will show that any two outer actions of Z^N on O_2 are cocycle conjugate.

entry.title: Completely positive maps and extremal K-set
entry.summary: We explain how to find the KK-theoretic counterpart of extremal K-set defined by Larry Brown and Gert Pedersen.

entry.title: C*-Algebras Generated by Partial Isometries
entry.summary: In this paper, we characterize the C*-Algebra generated by partial isometries.

entry.title: A Markov dilation for self-adjoint Schur multipliers
entry.summary: We give a formula for Markov dilation in the sense of Anantharaman-Delaroche for real positive Schur multipliers on $\B(H)$
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in proceedings of ams

entry.title: One more pathology of C*-algebraic tensor products
entry.summary: We define a collection of tensor product norms for C*-algebras and show that a symmetric tensor product functor on the category of separable C*-algebras need not be associative.

entry.title: Strongly self-absorbing C*-algebras are Z-stable
entry.summary: We prove the title. This characterizes the Jiang-Su algebra Z as the uniquely determined initial object in the category of strongly self-absorbing C*-algebras.

entry.title: Quantum isometry groups
entry.summary: This thesis contains the formulation and computation of quantum isometry groups.

entry.title: D-Bar Operators on Quantum Domains
entry.summary: We study the index problem for the d-bar operators subject to Atiyah- Patodi-Singer boundary conditions on noncommutative disk and annulus.

entry.title: Non-commutative $L_p$-spaces associated with a Maharam trace
entry.summary: Non-commutative $L_p$-spaces $L^p(M,\Phi)$ associated with the Maharam trace are defined and their dual spaces are described.

entry.title: Traces on crossed products
entry.summary: We give a description of traces on C(X)\rtimes G in terms of measurable fields of traces on the C*-algebras of the stabilizers of the action of G on X.

entry.title: Extreme points and embeddings with factorial commutant
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Uniform Convergence and the Central Limit Theorem
entry.summary: We prove results about uniform convergence of densities in the free central limit theorem without assumptions of boundedness on the support.

entry.title: Measure-Multiplicity of the Laplacian masa
entry.summary: It is shown that for the Laplacian masa in the free group factors, the orthocomplement of the associated Jones' projection is an infinite direct sum of coarse bimodules.

entry.title: A note on the uniqueness of involution in locally C*-algebras
entry.summary: In the present note we show that the involution in locally C*-algebras is uniquely determined.

entry.title: Comparison of Completely Positive Maps on Hilbert C*-Modules
entry.summary: We prove a Radon-Nikodym type theorem for completely positive maps on Hilbert C*-modules.

entry.title: Groupoid cocycles and derivations
entry.summary: This is a study of derivations constructed from conditionally negative type functions on groupoids which illustrates Sauvageot's theory of non-commutative Dirichlet forms.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to Annals of Functional Analysis; replaces submit/0402259

entry.title: Faithful compact quantum group actions on connected compact metrizable spaces
entry.summary: We construct faithful actions of quantum permutation groups on connected compact metrizable spaces. This disproves a conjecture of Goswami.

entry.title: Hilbert von Neumann Modules versus Concrete von Neumann Modules
entry.summary: Hilbert von Neumann modules and concrete von Neumann modules are the same thing.

entry.title: Amalgamated free products of commutative C*-algebras are residually finite-dimensional
entry.summary: We prove that an amalgamated free product of separable commutative C*-algebras is residually finite-dimensional.

entry.title: 2-local derivations on semi-finite von Neumann algebras
entry.summary: In the present paper we prove that every 2-local derivation on a semi-finite von Neumann algebra is a derivation.

entry.title: The mathematical legacy of William Arveson
entry.summary: This is a retrospective of some of William Arveson's many contributions to operator theory and operator algebras.

entry.title: An erratum to "Property (RD) for Hecke pairs"
entry.summary: We correct an error in the article "Property (RD) for Hecke pairs".

entry.title: Weakening idempotency in K-theory
entry.summary: We show that the K-theory of C*-algebras can be defined by pairs of matrices satisfying less strict relations than idempotency.

entry.title: Commuting Squares and Index for Subfactors
entry.summary: This is the 1990 Ph.D. thesis of John Kehlet Schou, advised by Uffe Haagerup at Odense University.

entry.title: On the Choi-Effros multiplication
entry.summary: A short proof is given for the well-known Choi-Effros theorem on the structure of ranges of completely positive projections.

entry.title: Arens algebras of measurable operators for Maharam traces
entry.summary: We study order and topological properties of the non-commutative Arens algebra associated with arbitrary Maharam trace.

entry.title: Pick Interpolation for free holomorphic functions
entry.summary: We prove an interpolation theorem for bounded free holomorphic functions.

entry.title: Schur tensor product of operator spaces
entry.summary: We develop a systematic study of the schur tensor product both in the category of operator spaces and in that of $C^*$-algebras.

entry.title: Pseudo-Diagonals and Uniqueness Theorems
entry.summary: We examine a certain type of abelian C*-subalgebras that allow one to give a unified treatment of two uniqueness theorems: for graph C*-algebras and for certain reduced crossed products.

entry.title: Geometric Description of L$_1$-Spaces
entry.summary: We describe strongly facially symmetric spaces which are isometrically isomorphic to L$_1$-space.

entry.title: Free probability, planar algebras, and the multicolored Guionnet-Jones-Shlyakhtenko construction
entry.summary: This is the graduate thesis of Michael Hartglass at UC Berkeley. A multicolored variant of the Guionnet-Jones-Shlyakhtenko construction is explored.

entry.title: Continuous Fields of Postliminal C*-algebras
entry.summary: We discuss a problem of Dixmier on continuous fields of postliminal C*-algebras and the greatest liminal ideals of the fibers.

entry.title: A note on "Weak limits of almost invariant projections"
entry.summary: We give alternative proofs to certain results in the paper "Weak limits of almost invariant projections" by using ultraproducts of operators.

entry.title: Haar Systems on Equivalent Groupoids
entry.summary: For second countable locally compact Hausdorff groupoids, the property of possessing a Haar system is preserved by equivalence.

entry.title: Characterization of central elements of operator algebras by inequalities
entry.summary: We propose a list of inequalities which characterize central elements in von Neumann algebras and C*-algebras.

entry.title: Finite digraphs and KMS states
entry.summary: The paper contains a description of the KMS states and ground states of a generalized gauge action on the C*-algebra of a finite graph.

entry.title: Connes embeddability of graph products
entry.summary: We prove that the Connes embedding problem is stable under graph products.

entry.title: Uniqueness of W*-tensor Products
entry.summary: In contrast to C*-algebras, distinct C*-norms on the algebraic tensor product of two W*-algebras produce isomorphic W*-tensor products

entry.title: On Logarithmic Sobolev Inequality for the Noncommutative Two Torus
entry.summary: An analogue of Gross' logarithmic Sobolev inequality for a class of elements of noncommutative two tori is proved.

entry.title: An inequality in noncommutative $L_p$-spaces
entry.summary: We prove that for any (trace-preserving) conditional expectation $\mathcal E$ on a noncommutative $L_p$ with $p>2$, $Id-\mathcal E$ is a contraction on the positive cone $L_p^+$.

entry.title: Notes on ergodic theorems in non-commutative symmetric spaces
entry.summary: In this paper we establish individual ergodic theorem for positive kernels (or so called Danford Shwartz (DS+) operators acting on non commutative symmetric spaces.

entry.title: $2$--hyperreflexivity and hyporeflexivity of power partial isometries
entry.summary: Power partial isometries are not always hyperreflexive neither reflexive. In the present paper it will be shown that power partial isometries are always hyporeflexive and $2$--hyperreflexive.

entry.title: A properly infinite C*-algebra which is not K_1-injective
entry.summary: We construct in this note a unital properly infinite C*-algebra which is not K$_1$-injective.

entry.title: Universal enveloping TROs and structure of W*-TROs
entry.summary: Calculation of the universal enveloping TROs of continuous JBW$*-triples, and application of the techniques used to supplement the structural results of Ruan for W*-TROs.

entry.title: Holomorphic Hilbert Bundles and the Frame Existence Problem
entry.summary: We show that if $A=K(l^2)+ \mathbb{C}I_{l^2}$, then there exists a Hilbert $A$-module that possess no frames.

entry.title: Some notes on Morita equivalence of Operator Algebras
entry.summary: In this paper we present some key moments in the history of Morita equivalence for operator algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been published in Serdica Mathematical Journal

entry.title: Semigroup homomorphisms on matrix algebras
entry.summary: We explore the connection between ring homomorphisms and semigroup homomorphisms on matrix algebras over rings or $C^*$-algebras.

entry.title: Cwikel estimates revisited
entry.summary: In this paper, we propose a new approach to Cwikel estimates both for the Euclidean space and for the noncommutative Euclidean space.

entry.title: Connes integration formula for the noncommutative plane
entry.summary: Our aim is to prove the integration formula on the noncommutative (Moyal) plane in terms of singular traces {\it a la} Connes.

entry.title: C*-Algebra Distance Filters
entry.summary: We use non-symmetric distances to give a self-contained account of C*-algebra filters and their corresponding compact projections, simultaneously simplifying and extending their general theory.

entry.title: On graded C*-algebras
entry.summary: We show that every topological grading of a C*-algebra by a discrete abelian group is implemented by an action of the compact dual group.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Bull Aust Math Soc

entry.title: Relative weak mixing of W*-dynamical systems via joinings
entry.summary: A characterization of relative weak mixing in W*-dynamical systems in terms of a relatively independent joining is proven.

entry.title: On the classification of free Araki-Woods factors
entry.summary: Using Hjorth's theory of turbulence, we prove that the free Araki-Woods factors are not classifiable by countable structures.

entry.title: Free stochastic measures via noncrossing partitions II
entry.summary: We show that for stochastic measures with freely independent increments, the partition-dependent stochastic measures of math.OA/9903084 can be expressed purely in terms of the higher stochastic measures and the higher diagonal measures of the original.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, AMS-LaTeX2e. A serious revision following the suggestions by the referee

entry.title: Fidelity preserving maps on density operators
entry.summary: We prove that any bijective fidelity preserving transformation on the set of all density operators on a Hilbert space is implemented by an either unitary or antiunitary operator on the underlying Hilbert space.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is corrected version of the paper math.OA/0108060. The paper has already appeared in ROMP (vol. 48 (2001), 299-303)

entry.title: Homogeneity of the pure state space of a separable C*-algebra
entry.summary: We prove that the pure state space is homogeneous under the action of the automorphism group (or the subgroup of asymptotically inner automorphisms) for all the separable simple C*-algebras. The first result of this kind was shown by Powers for the UHF algebras some 30 years ago.
entry.arxiv:comment: This generalizes and replaces the paper(math.OA/0104258) with a similar title by A. Kishimoto and S. Sakai

entry.title: Every simple higher dimensional noncommutative torus is an AT algebra
entry.summary: We prove that every simple higher dimensional noncommutative torus is an AT algebra.
entry.arxiv:comment: AMSLaTeX; 22 pages. This paper replaces Sections 5 through 7 of the unpublished long preprint arXiv:math.OA/0306410. A number of minor improvements have been made, particularly near the end

entry.title: A splitting property for subalgebras of tensor products
entry.summary: We prove a basic result about tensor products of a $\text{II}_1$ factor with a finite von Neumann algebra and use it to answer, affirmatively, a question asked by S. Popa about maximal injective factors.

entry.title: Bourgain algebras, minimal envelopes, minimal support sets, and some applications
entry.summary: We explicitly compute certain Douglas algebras that are invariant under both the Bourgain map and the minimal envelope map. We also compute the Bourgain algebra and the minimal envelope of the maximal subalgebras of a certain singly generated Douglas algebra.

entry.title: Some conditions on Douglas algebras that imply the invariance of the minimal envelope map
entry.summary: We give several conditions on certain families of Douglas algebras that imply that the minimal envelope of the given algebra is the algebra itself. We also prove that the minimal envelope of the intersection of two Douglas algebras is the intersection of their minimal envelope.

entry.title: C*-actions of r-discrete groupoids and inverse semigroups
entry.summary: Groupoid actions on C*-bundles and inverse semigroup actions on C*-algebras are closely related when the groupoid is r-discrete.

entry.title: Quantum Spheres As Groupoid C*-algebras
entry.summary: We show that the C*-algebra of a quantum sphere $C(S_{q}^{2n+1})$ can be realized as a groupoid C*-algebra of a groupoid which is explicitly identified and is independent of the parameter $q$.

entry.title: Factorization of completely bounded bilinear operators and injectivity
entry.summary: We characterize injectivity of von Neumann algebras in terms of factoring bilinear maps as products of linear maps.

entry.title: Representable bimodules over C*-algebras
entry.summary: Given two C*-algebras A and B, abstract A-B bimodules that can be isometrically represented as operator bimodules are characterised in terms of their norm. Various properties of such bimodules are given. Their theory is very similar to those of classical normed spaces.

entry.title: Charged Quantum Fields Associated with Endomorphisms of CAR and CCR Algebras
entry.summary: Quasi-free endomorphisms of the CAR and CCR algebras are studied from the point of view of the theory of superselection sectors.
entry.arxiv:comment: 111 pages, no figures; the author's PhD thesis in physics

entry.title: The K-theory of Cuntz-Krieger algebras for infinite matrices
entry.summary: We compute the K-theory of the Cuntz-Krieger C^*-algebras associated to infinite matrices.
entry.arxiv:comment: Final version with substantial improvements and corrections, LaTeX, 14 pages, no figures

entry.title: Topological Entropy for the Canonical Endomorphism of Cuntz-Krieger Algebras
entry.summary: It is shown that Voiculescu's toplogical entropy for the canonical endomorphism of a simple Cuntz-Krieger algebra O_A equals the logarithm of the spectral radius of A.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, LaTeX2e, uses AMSLaTeX and xy-pic

entry.title: The transformation groups whose C^*-algebras are Fell algebras
entry.summary: Let (G,X) be a locally compact transformation group, in which G acts freely on X. We show that the associated transformation-group C^*-algebra is a Fell algebra if and only if X is a Cartan G-space.

entry.title: On unbounded p-summable Fredholm modules
entry.summary: We prove that odd unbounded p-summable Fredholm modules are also bounded p-summable Fredholm modules (this is the odd counterpart of a result of A. Connes for the case of even Fredholm modules).

entry.title: On $C^*$-algebras related to asymptotic homomorphisms
entry.summary: We study the $C^*$-algebras related to Mishchenko's version of asymptotic homomorphisms. In particular we show that their different versions are weakly homotopy equivalent but not isomorphic to each other. We give also the continuous version for these algebras.

entry.title: C*-tensor categories and free product bimodules
entry.summary: A C*-tensor category with simple unit object is realized by von Neumann algebra bimodules of finite Jones index if and only if it is rigid.

entry.title: Exactness of reduced amalgamated free product C*-algebras
entry.summary: Some completely positive maps on reduced amalgamated free products of C*-algebras are constructed; these allow a proof that the class of exact unital C*-algebras is closed under taking reduced amalgamated free products. Consequently, the class of exact discrete groups is closed under taking amalgamated free products.

entry.title: Secondary Characteristic Classes and Cyclic Cohomology of Hopf Algebras
entry.summary: We give a construction of cyclic cocycles representing the equivariant characteristic classes of equivariant bundles. Our formulas generalize Connes' Godbillon-Vey cyclic cocycle. An essential tool of our construction is Connes-Moscovici's theory of cyclic cohomology of Hopf algebras.

entry.title: Amenability and exactness for dynamical systems and their C*-algebras
entry.summary: In this survey, we study the relations between amenability (resp. amenability at infinity) of C*-dynamical systems and equality or nuclearity (resp. exactness) of the corresponding crossed products.

entry.title: On isomorphisms of standard operator algebras
entry.summary: The aim of this paper is to show that between standard operator algebras every bijective map with a certain multiplicativity property related to Jordan triple isomorphisms of associative rings is automatically additive.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages. To appear in Studia Math

entry.title: A survey of noncommutative dynamical entropy
entry.summary: The paper is a survey of dynamical entropy of automorphisms of operator algebras. We describe the different entropies of Connes-Stormer, Connes-Narnhofer-Thirring, Sauvageot-Thouvenot, and Voiculescu, and discuss the main examples of the theory.

entry.title: K-theory of C^*-algebras from one-dimensional generalized solenoids
entry.summary: We compute the K-groups of C^*-algebras arising from one-dimensional generalized solenoids. The results show that Ruelle algebras from one-dimensional generalized solenoids are one-dimensional generalizations of Cuntz-Krieger algebras.

entry.title: Prime Type III Factors
entry.summary: We show that for each (0<\lambda <1), the free Araki-Woods factor of type III(_{\lambda}) cannot be written as a tensor product of two diffuse von Neumann algebras (i.e., is prime), and does not contain a Cartan subalgebra.

entry.title: Characterizing Type I C*-algebras via Entropy
entry.summary: Let A be a unital separable C*-algebra. We observe that A is type I if and only if the CNT-entropy of every inner automorphism of A is zero.

entry.title: A note on idempotents in finite AW*-factors
entry.summary: We prove that the value of the quasi-trace on an idempotent element in a AW*-factor of type II_1 is the same as the dimension of its left (or right) support.

entry.title: A note on group actions on subfactors
entry.summary: We construct approximately inner actions of discrete amenable groups on strongly amenable subfactors of type II_1 with given invariants, and obtain classification results under some conditions. We also study the lifting of the relative \chi group.

entry.title: Examples of Amenable Kac system
entry.summary: By giving an interesting characterisation of amenable multiplicative unitaries in term of one dimensional representations, we show in a simple way that bicrossproducts of amenable locally compact groups is both amenable and coamenable.

entry.title: On the uniqueness of AF diagonals in regular limit algebras
entry.summary: Necessary and sufficient conditions are obtained for the uniqueness of standard regular AF masas in regular limit algebras up to approximate inner unitary equivalence.

entry.title: K-theory computations for boundary algebras of $\tA_2$ groups
entry.summary: This is an appendix to the paper {\bf Asymptotic K-theory for groups acting on $\tA_2$ buildings}, and contains the results of the computations performed by the authors.

entry.title: Free Entropy
entry.summary: Free entropy is the analogue of entropy in free probability theory. The paper is a survey of free entropy, its applications to von Neumann algebras, connections to random matrix theory and a discussion of open problems.

entry.title: Non-commutative Simplicial Complexes and the Baum-Connes Conjecture
entry.summary: We associate a non-commutative $C^*$-algebra with any locally finite simplicial complex. We determine the $K$-theory of these algebras and show that they can be used to obtain a conceptual explanation for the Baum-Connes conjecture.

entry.title: Geometric characterizations of some classes of operators in C*-algebras and von Neumann algebras
entry.summary: We present geometric characterizations of the partial isometries, unitaries, and invertible operators in C*-algebras and von Neumann algebras.

entry.title: Free subproducts and free scaled products of II_1 factors
entry.summary: The constructions of free subproducts of von Neumann algebras and free scaled products are introduced, and results about them are proved, including rescaling results and results about free trade in free scaled products.

entry.title: Biseparating maps between operator algebras
entry.summary: We prove that a biseparating map between spaces B(E), and some other Banach algebras, is automatically continuous and an algebra isomorphism.

entry.title: Z-Analytic TAF Algebras and Partial Dynamical Systems
entry.summary: Connections between partial dynamcial systems, a generalized notion of partial dynamical systems defined by nested sequences of partial homeomorphisms, and triangular AF algebras which admit an integer-valued cocycle are established.

author.name: Justin R. Peters Yiu T. Poon

entry.title: Boundary Representations for Operator Algebras
entry.summary: All operator algebras have (not necessarily irreducible) boundary representations. A unital operator algebra has enough such boundary representations to generate its C*-envelope.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages. Includes instructions for processing in pdfLaTeX

entry.title: Characterizations of the automorphisms of Hilbert space effect algebras
entry.summary: In this paper we characterize the automorphisms of Hilbert space effect algebras by means of their preserving properties which concern certain relations and quantities appearing in quantum measurement theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages. To appear in Commun. Math. Phys

entry.title: On bounded and unbounded idempotents whose sum is a multiple of the identity
entry.summary: We study bounded and unbounded representations of the $*$-algebra $Q_{n,\lambda}(*)$ generated by $n$ idempotents whose sum equals $\lambda e$ ($\lambda\in{\mathbb C}$, $e$ is the identity).

entry.title: A noncommutative version of the Banach-Stone Theorem
entry.summary: In this paper, we extend the Banach-Stone theorem to the non commutative case, i.e, we prove that the structure of the liminal $C^{*}$-algebras $\cal A$ determines the topology of its primitive ideal space.

entry.title: On crossed products of the Cuntz algebra ${\mathcal O}_\infty$ by quasi-free actions of abelian groups
entry.summary: We investigate the structures of crossed products of the Cuntz algebra ${\mathcal O}_\infty$ by quasi-free actions of abelian groups. We completely determine their ideal structures and compute the strong Connes spectra and K-groups.

entry.title: Metrics On The Quantum Heisenberg Manifold
entry.summary: Compact quantum metric spaces are order unit spaces along with a Lip norm. On the order unit space of the selfadjoint elements of the dense subalgebra of smooth elements in the quantum Heisenberg manifold we construct Lip norms.

entry.title: Homotopy invariance of AF-embeddability
entry.summary: We prove that AF-embeddability is a homotopy invariant in the class of separable exact $C^*$-algebras. This work was inspired by Spielberg's work on homotopy invariance of AF-embeddability and Dadarlat's serial works on AF-embeddability of residually finite dimensional $C^*$-algebras.

entry.title: A symmetric imprimitivity theorem for commuting proper actions
entry.summary: We initiate a careful study of a generalized symmetric imprimitivity theory for commuting proper actions of locally compact groups H and K on a C*-algebra.

entry.title: Complete isometries into C*-algebras
entry.summary: We give various characterizations of into (not necessarily onto) complete isometries between $C^*$-algebras, generalizing a classical result of Holsztynski. Our results are related to a natural embedding of the noncommutative Shilov boundary in a second dual.

entry.title: Quantum Markov Processes (Correspondences and Dilations)
entry.summary: We study the structure of quantum Markov Processes from the point of view of product systems and their representations.

entry.title: Fourier Algebras On Topological Foundation *-Semigroups
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of the Fourier and Fouier-Stieltjes algebra of a topological *-semigroup and show that these are commutative Banach algebras. For a class of foundation semigroups, we show that these are preduals of von Neumann algebras.

entry.title: The Curvature and Index of Completely Positive Maps
entry.summary: We study conjugacy invariants for completely positive maps that are inspired by the concept of curvature introduced for commuting d-tuples of contractions by Arveson

entry.title: On the structure of C*-algebras generated by the components of polar decompositions
entry.summary: In the present paper we study the structure of C^*-algebras generated by the components of the polar decompositions of operators in Hilbert space satisfying certain commutation relations.

entry.title: The topological version of free entropy
entry.summary: Notions of topological free entropy and of free capacity are introduced in the $C^*$-algebra context. Basic properties, basic problems and connections to potential theory and random matrix theory are discussed.

entry.title: Extensions of C*-algebras by partial isometries
entry.summary: In the present paper we study the structure of C*-$algebras generated by a certain *-algebra A and a partial isometry inducing an endomorphism of A.

entry.title: From C*algebra extensions to CQMS, ${SU}_q(2)$, Podles sphere and other examples
entry.summary: We construct compact quantum metric spaces (CQMS) starting with some C*algebra extension with a positive splitting. As special cases we discuss the case of Toeplitz algebra, quantum SU(2) and Podles sphere.

entry.title: Interpolation properties for some scales of approximation spaces
entry.summary: We obtain a result concerning the stability under the interpolation with functional parameter method for the approximation spaces of Lorentz-Marcinkiewicz type and also for the approximation spaces generated by symmetric norming functions of a certain type.

entry.title: The primitive ideal space of the C*-algebras of infinite graphs
entry.summary: For any countable directed graph E we describe the primitive ideal space of the corresponding generalized Cuntz-Krieger algebra C*(E).

entry.title: Amalgamated free product over Cartan subalgebra, II. Supplementary results & Examples
entry.summary: Supplementary results obtained after the completion of our previous paper are given together with discussing some examples. A quick review of the previous paper is also included.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the proceedings of US-Japan Seminar 1999; This paper was written in 2000

entry.title: A simple proof of a theorem on (2n)-weak amenability
entry.summary: A simple proof of (2n)-weak amenability of the triangular Banach algebra T= [(A A) (0 A)] is given where A is a unital C*-algebra.

entry.title: The Wavelet Galerkin Operator
entry.summary: In connection to wavelet theory, we describe the peripheral spectrum of the transfer operator. The solution involves the analysis of certain representations of the algebra generated by two unitaries $U$ and $T$ that satisfy the commutation relation $UTU^{-1}=T^N$.

entry.title: Jensen's trace inequality in several variables
entry.summary: Jensen's trace inequality is established for every multivariable, convex function and every trace or trace-like functional on a C*-algebra.

entry.title: A double commutant theorem for operator algebras
entry.summary: Every unital nonselfadjoint operator algebra possesses canonical and functorial classes of faithful (even completely isometric) Hilbert space representations satisfying a double commutant theorem generalizing von Neumann's classical result. Examples and complementary results are given.

entry.title: Excision and a Theorem of Popa
entry.summary: We give an elementary C*-algebraic proof of a result of Sorin Popa which is of fundamental importance to Elliott's Classification Program.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages. Revised the introduction and one more reference added

entry.title: Connes' Embedding Problem and Lance's WEP
entry.summary: A II_1 factor embeds into the ultraproduct of the hyperfinite II_1 factor if and only if it satisfies the W*-analogue of Lance's weak expectation property. This note gives a self contained proof of this fact.

entry.title: The non-microstates free entropy dimension of DT-operators
entry.summary: Dykema and Haagerup introduced the class of DT-operators and also showed that every DT-operator generate the von Neumann algebra generated by the free group on two generators. In this paper we prove that Voiculescu's non-microstates free entropy dimension is 2 for all DT-operators.

entry.title: C*-algebra generated by projections
entry.summary: The universal C*-algebra generated by n projections has been described. As an immediate corollary one obtains structure theorem for a pair of projections and the solution to an associated index problem. This puts the study of a pair of projections in the proper perspective of noncommutative geometry.

entry.title: About the QWEP conjecture
entry.summary: This is a detailed survey on the QWEP conjecture and Connes' embedding problem. Most of contents are taken from Kirchberg's paper [Invent. Math. 112 (1993)].
entry.arxiv:comment: 30 pages. Any comments are welcome. Minor changes

entry.title: Some Cauchy-Bunyakovsky-Schwarz Type Inequalities for Sequences of Operators in Hilbert Spaces
entry.summary: Some inequalities of Cauchy-Bunyakovsky-Schwarz type for sequences of bounded linear operators in Hilbert spaces and some applications are given.

entry.title: Topological Quantum Field Theories and Operator Algebras
entry.summary: We review "quantum" invariants of closed oriented 3-dimensional manifolds arising from operator algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: For proceedings of "International Workshop on Quantum Field Theory and Noncommutative Geometry", Sendai, November 2002

entry.title: A note on fixed points of completely positive maps
entry.summary: It is shown that a fixed point of a completely positive map on a semi-finite von Neumann algebra must commute with the operators determining the map (the Lueders phenomenon) if the element is finite or has finite square.

entry.title: A construction of $C^*$-algebras from $C^*$-correspondences
entry.summary: We introduce a method to define $C^*$-algebras from $C^*$-correspondences. Our construction generalizes Cuntz-Pimsner algebras, crossed products by Hilbert $C^*$-modules, and graph algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, to appear in Contemp. Math., Proceedings of the AMS conference "Advances in Quantum Dynamics"

entry.title: Exactness and uniform embeddability of discrete groups
entry.summary: We define a numerical quasi-isometry invariant of a finitely generated group, whose values parametrize the difference between the group being uniformly embeddable in a Hilbert space and the reduced C*-algebra of the group being exact.

entry.title: Modular invariants and their fusion rules
entry.summary: The subfactor approach to modular invariants gives insight into the fusion rule structure of the modular invariants.

entry.title: You Can See the Arrows in a Quiver Operator Algebra
entry.summary: We prove that two quiver operator algebras can be isometrically isomorphic only if the quivers (=directed graphs) are isomorphic. We also show how the graph can be recovered from certain representations of the algebra.

entry.title: Every AF-algebra is Morita equivalent to a graph algebra
entry.summary: We show how to modify any Bratteli diagram $E$ for an AF-algebra $A$ to obtain a Bratteli diagram $KE$ for $A$ whose graph algebra $C^*(KE)$ contains both $A$ and $C^*(E)$ as full corners.

entry.title: Relative Cuntz-Krieger algebras of finitely aligned higher-rank graphs
entry.summary: We define the relative Cuntz-Krieger algebras associated to finitely aligned higher-rank graphs. We prove versions of the gauge-invariant uniqueness theorem and the Cuntz-Krieger uniqueness theorem for relative Cuntz-Krieger algebras.

entry.title: Spectral factorization in the non-stationary Wiener algebra
entry.summary: We define the non-stationary analogue of the Wiener algebra and prove a spectral factorization theorem in this algebra.

entry.title: Free analog of pressure and its Legendre transform
entry.summary: The free analog of the pressure is introduced for multivariate noncommutative random variables and its Legendre transform is compared with Voiculescu's microstate free entropy.

entry.title: Finite Free Entropy and Free Group Factors
entry.summary: We show the existence of noncommutative random variables with finite free entropy but which do not generate a free group factor.

entry.title: Groupoid cohomology and extensions
entry.summary: We show that Haefliger's cohomology for etale groupoids, Moore's cohomology for locally compact groups and the Brauer group of a locally compact groupoid are all particular cases of sheaf (or Cech) cohomology for topological simplicial spaces.

entry.title: C^*-algebras generated by scaling elements
entry.summary: We investigate C^*-algebras generated by scaling elements. We generalize the Wold decomposition and Coburn's theorem on isometries to scaling elements. We also completely determine when the C^*-algebra generated by a scaling element contains an infinite projection.

entry.title: Moment Series and R-transform of the Generating Operator of $L(F_{N})$
entry.summary: In this paper, we will consider the free probability theory of free group factor $L(F_{N}),$ where $F_{k}$ is the free group with $k$-generators. We compute the moment series and the R-transform of the generating operator, $T=g_{1}+...+g_{N}+g_{1}^{-1}+..+g_{N}^{-1}.$

entry.title: Failure of the Raikov theorem for free random variables
entry.summary: We show that the sum of two free random variables can have a free Poisson law without any of them having a free Poisson law.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, to appear in Seminaire de Probabilites

entry.title: A Banach Algebra Approach To Amalgamated R- and S-transforms
entry.summary: We give a Banach algebra approach to the additiveness property of Voiculescu's amalgamated R-transform. We also define an amalgamated S-transform and prove that it is multiplicative on products of amalgamated free random variables when the algebra of amalgamation is commutative.

entry.title: Multiplicative Monotone Convolution
entry.summary: We show that the monotonic independence introduced by Muraki can also be used to define a multiplicative convolution. We also find a method for the calculation of this convolution based on an appropriate form of the Cauchy transform. We discuss infinite divisibility in the multiplicative monotonic context as well.

entry.title: A 1-cohomology characterization of property (T) in von Neumann algebras
entry.summary: We obtain a characterization of property (T) for von Neumann algebras in terms of 1-cohomology similar to the Delorme-Guichardet Theorem for groups.

entry.title: Essential representations of C*-correspondences
entry.summary: Let E be a C*-correspondence over a C*-algebra \A with non-degenerate faithful left action. We show that E admits sufficiently many essential representations (i.e. representations \psi such that \psi(E)H = H to recover the Cuntz-Pimsner algebra O_E.

entry.title: Free transportation cost inequalities for non-commutative multi-variables
entry.summary: We prove the free analogue of the transportation cost inequality for tracial distributions of non-commutative self-adjoint (also unitary) multi-variables based on random matrix approximation procedure.

entry.title: Approximate AF flows
entry.summary: When $\alpha$ is a flow on a unital AF algebra $A$ such that there is an increasing sequence of finite-dimensional $\alpha$-invariant C*-subalgebras of $A$ with dense union, we call $\alpha$ an AF flow. We show that an approximate AF flow is a cocycle perturbation of an AF flow.

entry.title: A free analogue of the transportation cost inequality on the circle
entry.summary: We give a new proof of the free transportation cost inequality for measures on the circle following M. Ledoux's idea.

entry.title: Crossed product of a C*-algebra by an endomorphism, coefficient algebras and transfer operators
entry.summary: The paper presents a construction of the crossed product of a C*-algebra by an endomorphism generated by partial isometry

entry.title: Morita Equivalence for Quantum Heisenberg Manifolds
entry.summary: We discuss Morita equivalence within the family of quantum Heisenberg manifolds. The main tool employed is the generalization of a result of P. Green and M. Rieffel about Morita equivalence of transformation groups to crossed products by Hilbert bimodules.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, to appear in the Proceedings of the AMS

entry.title: An operator ArzelÃ -Ascoli theorem
entry.summary: We generalize the Arzel\`a-Ascoli theorem to the setting of matrix order unit spaces, extending the work of Antonescu-Christensen on unital C*-algebras. This gives an affirmative answer to a question of Antonescu and Christensen.

entry.title: Graph-Based Models for Kirchberg Algebras
entry.summary: We give a construction of Kirchberg algebras from graphs. By using product graphs in the construction we are able to provide models for general (UCT) Kirchberg algebras while maintaining the explicit generators and relations of the underlying graphs.

entry.title: Non-separable AF-algebras
entry.summary: We give two pathological phenomena for non-separable AF-algebras which do not occur for separable AF-algebras. One is that non-separable AF-algebras are not determined by their Bratteli diagrams, and the other is that there exists a non-separable AF-algebra which is prime but not primitive.

entry.title: A Non-commutative analogue of Gaussian Hilbert Spaces
entry.summary: The paper gives analogues of some starting results in the theory of Gaussian Hilbert Spaces for semicircular distributed random variables. The transition from the commutative to the free frame is done considering matrices of increasing dimension and utilizing the Amitzur-Levitzki Theorem.

entry.title: The Moments of the Block Operators in a Group von Neumann Algebra
entry.summary: In this paper, we will compute the moments of the block operators, induced by the generators of the group, in a group von Neumann algebra and we will observe the identically distributedness.

entry.title: Jordan maps and triple maps on algebras of unbounded operators
entry.summary: The paper contains results on the structure of Jordan maps and several kinds of triple maps on standard algebras of unbounded operators in Hilbert spaces. These results are unbounded counterparts to results on algebras of bounded operators obtained by Lu, Moln\'ar and others ([3,4,6 -- 10]).

entry.title: On the maximality of subdiagonal algebras
entry.summary: We consider Arveson's problem on the maximality of subdiagonal algebras. We prove that a subdiagonal algebra is maximal if it is invariant under the modular group of a faithful normal state which is preserved by the conditional expectation associated with the subdiagonal algebra.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in J. Operator Theory

entry.title: On the best constants in some non-commutative martingale inequalities
entry.summary: We determine the optimal orders for the best constants in the non-commutative Burkholder-Gundy, Doob and Stein inequalities obtained recently in the non-commutative martingale theory.

entry.title: Multivariable moment problems
entry.summary: In this paper we solve moment problems for Poisson transforms and, more generally, for completely positive linear maps on unital C*-algebras generated by ''universal'' row contractions associated with the free semigroup with n generators.

entry.title: Induced representations of locally C*-algebras
entry.summary: In this paper, by analogy with the case of C*-algebras, we define the notion of induced representation of a locally C*-algebra, and then we prove a imprimitivity theorem for induced representations of locally C*-algebras.

entry.title: Strong Shift Equivalence in the C*-algebraic setting: Graphs and C*-correspondences
entry.summary: We discuss strong shift equivalence, which has been used to characterize conjugacy of edge shifts, and its application to C*-algebras of graphs and Cuntz-Pimsner algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, Written for the Proceedings of the 25th Meeting of the Great Plains Operator Theory Symposium

entry.title: Remarks on $B(H)\otimes B(H)$
entry.summary: We review the existing proofs that the min and max norms are different on $B(H)\otimes B(H)$ and give a shortcut avoiding the consideration of non-separable families of operator spaces.

entry.title: Spatial E_0-Semigroups are Restrictions of Inner Automorphismgroups
entry.summary: We show that an E_0-semigroup acting on the algebra of all adjointable operators on a Hilbert module, which has a spatial product system, arises as the the restriction of a semigroup inner automorphisms.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Number XX in Quantum Probability and White Noise Analysis, pages 348-355. World Scientific, 2007

entry.title: Factors generated by $C^*$-finitely correlated states
entry.summary: We present several equivalent conditions for $C^*$-finitely correlated states defined on the UHF algebras to be factor states and consider the types of factors generated by them. Subfactors generated by generalized quantum Markov chains defined on the gauge-invariant parts of the UHF algebras are also discussed.

entry.title: Use of operator algebras in the analysis of measures from wavelets and iterated function systems
entry.summary: In this paper, we show how a class of operators used in the analysis of measures from wavelets and iterated function systems may be understood from a special family of representations of Cuntz algebras.

entry.title: A not so simple local multiplier algebra
entry.summary: We construct an AF-algebra $A$ such that its local multiplier algebra $M_{\text{loc}}(A)$ does not agree with $M_{\text{loc}}(M_{\text{loc}}(A))$, thus answering a question raised by G.K. Pedersen in 1978.

entry.title: Free Probability on a Direct Product of Noncommutative Probability Spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we observevd the amalgamated free probability of direct product of noncommutative probability spaces. We defined the amalgamated R-transforms, amalgamated moment series and the amalgamated boxed convolution. They maks us to do the amalgamated R-transform calculus, like the scalar-valued case.

entry.title: The corona factorization property
entry.summary: The corona factorization property is a property with connections to extension theory, K-theory and the structure of C*algebras. This paper is a short survey of the subject, together with some new results and open questions.

entry.title: Crossed products of locally C*-algebras
entry.summary: The crossed products of locally C*-algebras are defined and a Takai duality theorem for inverse limit actions of a locally compact group on a locally C*-algebra is proved.
entry.arxiv:comment: 26 pages, to appear, Rocky Mountain J. Math

entry.title: Properties preserved under Morita equivalence of C*-algebras
entry.summary: We show that important structural properties of C*-algebras and the multiplicity numbers of representations are preserved under Morita equivalence.

entry.title: Hermitian operators and convex functions
entry.summary: Several inequalities for eigenvalues involving convex combinations and compressions are given. These inequalities are matrix version of the basic convexity inequality f((a+b)/2) < (f(a)+f(b))/2.

entry.title: L^2-Betti numbers for subfactors
entry.summary: We study L^2-Betti numbers for von Neumann algebras, as defined by D. Shlyakhtenko and A. Connes, in the presence of a bi-finite correspondence and prove a proportionality formula.

entry.title: Bundles of C*-correspondences over directed graphs and a theorem of Ionescu
entry.summary: We give a short proof of a recent theorem of Ionescu which shows that the Cuntz-Pimsner C*-algebra of a certain correspondence associated to a Mauldin-Williams graph is isomorphic to the graph algebra.

entry.title: Involutive equivalence bimodules and inclusions of C*-algebras with Watatani index 2
entry.summary: Let A be a unital C*-algebra. We shall introduce involutive A-A-equivalence bimodules and prove that any C*-algebra containing A with Watatani index 2 is constructed by an involutive A-A-equivalence bimodule.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, to appear in J. Operator Theory

entry.title: Limit Theorems in Free Probability Theory I
entry.summary: Based on a new analytical approach to the definition of additive free convolution on probability measures on the real line we prove free analogs of limit theorems for sums for non-identically distributed random variables in classical Probability Theory.

entry.title: The representation category of the Woronowicz quantum group S_mu U(d) as a braided tensor C*-category
entry.summary: An abstract characterization of the representation category of the Woronowicz twisted SU(d) group is given, generalizing analogous results known in the classical case

entry.title: Compact quantum group actions on C*-algebras and invariant derivations
entry.summary: We define the notion of invariant derivation of a C*-algebra under a compact quantum group action and prove that in certain conditions, such derivations are generators of one parameter automorphism groups.

entry.title: The free entropy dimension of some $L^{\infty}[0,1]$-circular operators
entry.summary: We find the microstates free entropy dimension of a large class of $L^{\infty}[0,1]$-circular operators, in the presence of a generator of the diagonal subalgebra.

entry.title: Functional form of unitary representations of the quantum "az+b" group
entry.summary: The formula for all unitary representations of the quantum "az+b" group for a real deformation parameter is given. The description involves the quantum exponential function introduced by Woronowicz.

entry.title: New quantum "az+b" groups
entry.summary: We construct quantum "az+b" groups for new values of the deformation parameter. Along the way we introduce new special functions and study their analytic properties as well as analyze the commutation relations determined by the choice of parameter.

entry.title: Not all pure states on B(H) are diagonalizable
entry.summary: Assuming the continuum hypothesis, we prove that B(H) has a pure state whose restriction to any masa is not pure. This resolves negatively an old conjecture of Anderson.

entry.title: E_0-Semigroups for Continuous Product Systems
entry.summary: We show that every continuous product system of correspondences over a unital C*-algebra occurs as the product system of a strictly continuous E_0-semigroup.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Infin. Dimens. Anal. Quantum Probab. Relat. Top. 10 (381-395) 2007

entry.title: Reduced Free Products of Finite Dimensional $C^*$-Algebras
entry.summary: We find a necessary and sufficient conditions for the simplicity and uniqueness of trace for reduced free products of finite families of finite dimensional $C^*$-algebras with specified traces on them.

entry.title: A tensor product of representations of Cuntz algebras
entry.summary: We introduce a nonsymmetric, associative tensor product among representations of Cuntz algebras by using embeddings. We show the decomposition formulae of tensor products for permutative representations explicitly We apply decomposition formulae to determine properties of endomorphisms.

entry.title: The Szemeredi property for compact C*-dynamical systems
entry.summary: Furstenberg's multiple recurrence result for measure theoretic dynamical systems is proved for compact C*-dynamical systems for which the evolution is given by a semigroup with the right cancellation property, a right invariant measure and containing a Folner net.

entry.title: One noncommutative differential calculus coming from the inner derivation
entry.summary: We define a noncommutative differential calculus constructed from the inner derivation, then several relevant examples are showed. It is of interest to note that for certain $C^*$-algebra, this calculus is closely related to the classical one when the algebra associates a deformation parameter.

entry.title: Automorphisms of the type II_1 Arveson system of Warren's noise
entry.summary: Motions of the plane (shifts and rotations) correspond to automorphisms of the type I Arveson system of white noise. I prove that automorphisms corresponding to rotations cannot be extended to the type II Arveson system of Warren's noise.

entry.title: The asymptotic behavios of free convolution
entry.summary: We give a streamlined proof of the limit theorems for the free additive convolution of infinitesimal triangular arrays of probability measures on the real line. The result was first proved by Chistyakov and G\"otze using analytic subordination.

entry.title: Hochschild Cohomology of II_1 Factors with Cartan Masas
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that for a type II_1 factor N with a Cartan maximal abelian subalgebra (masa), the Hochschild cohomology groups H^n(N,N)=0, for all n \geq 1. This generalizes the result of Sinclair and Smith, who proved this for all N having separable predual.

entry.title: Orbifolds are not commutative geometries
entry.summary: In this note we show that the crucial orientation condition for commutative geometries fails for the natural spectral triple of an orbifold M/G.

entry.title: The equivariant analytic index for proper groupoid actions
entry.summary: The paper constructs the analytic index for an elliptic pseudodifferential family of $L^{m}_{\rho,\de}$-operators invariant under the proper action of a continuous family groupoid on a $G$-compact, $C^{\infty,0}$ $G$-space.

entry.title: C_{0}-Hilbert Modules
entry.summary: We provide the definition and fundamental properties of algebraic elements with respect to an operator satisfying hypothesis (h). Furthermore, we analyze Hilbert modules using C_0-operators relative to a bounded finitely connected region Omega in the complex plane.

entry.title: The Cuntz semigroup as an invariant for C*-algebras
entry.summary: A category is described to which the Cuntz semigroup belongs and as a functor into which it preserves inductive limits.
entry.arxiv:comment: 42 pages, submitted to J. Reine Agnew. Math

entry.title: Additive preserving rank one maps on Hilbert $C^\ast$-modules
entry.summary: In this paper, we characterize a class of additive maps on Hilbert $C^\ast$-modules which maps a "rank one" adjointable operators to another rank one operators.

entry.title: An analogue of Szego's limit theorem in free probability theory
entry.summary: In the paper, we discuss orthogonal polynomials in free probability theory. Especially, we prove an analogue of of Szego's limit theorem in free probability theory.

entry.title: On frames in Hilbert modules over pro-C*-algebras
entry.summary: We introduce the concept of frame of multipliers in Hilbert modules over pro-C*-algebras and show that many properties of frames in Hilbert C*-modules are valid for frames of multipliers in Hilbert modules over pro-C*-algebras.

entry.title: A mean ergodic theorem for actions of amenable quantum groups
entry.summary: We prove a weak form of the mean ergodic theorem for actions of amenable locally compact quantum groups in the von Neumann algebra setting.

entry.title: On freely indecomposable measures
entry.summary: We show that a probability measure is not a nontrivial free additive convolution if it puts no mass in an interval whose endpoints are atoms. The analogous results for free multiplicative convolutions are proved as well. The proofs use analytic subordination.

entry.title: An application of Mirror extensions
entry.summary: In this paper we apply our previous results of mirror extensions to obtain realizations of three modular invariants constructed by A. N. Schellekens by holomorphic conformal nets with central charge equal to 24.

entry.title: Group Bundle Duality
entry.summary: This paper introduces a generalization of Pontryagin duality for locally compact Hausdorff abelian groups to locally compact Hausdorff abelian group bundles.

entry.title: Die lokale Struktur von T-DualitÃ¤tstripeln
entry.summary: We show that the $C^*$-algebraic approach to T-duality of Mathai and Rosenberg is equivalent to the topological approach of Bunke and Schick.
entry.arxiv:comment: 100 pages, German title and preface, the author's thesis

entry.title: The Jiang-Su algebra does not always embed
entry.summary: We exhibit a unital simple nuclear non-type-I C*-algebra into which the Jiang-Su algebra does not embed unitally. This answers a question of M. R{\o}rdam.

entry.title: On Existence and Uniqueness of Universal Enveloping Locally C*-Algebra for a Locally JB-Algebra
entry.summary: A theorem is presented on existence and uniqueness up to the topological *-isomorphism of universal locally C*-algebra for an arbitrary locally JB-algebra.

entry.title: Quasi-orthogonal subalgebras of matrix algebras
entry.summary: We investigate pairwise quasi-orthogonal subalgebras in $M_{p^{kn}}$ which are isomorphic to $M_{p^{k}}$ for $k \ge 1$, $n \ge 2$ and a prime number $p$ with $p \ge 3$. We prove there exist $p^{2kn}-1/p^{2k}-1$ such subalgebras and they span $M_{p^{kn}}$.

entry.title: Analytic Subordination for Free Compression
entry.summary: We extend the free difference quotient coalgebra approach to analytic subordination to the case of a free compression in free probability.

entry.title: An example of a solid von Neumann algebra
entry.summary: We prove that the group-measure-space von Neumann algebra $L^\infty(T^2) \rtimes SL(2,Z)$ is solid. The proof uses topological amenability of the action of $SL(2,Z)$ on the Higson corona of $Z^2$.

entry.title: Approximation of center-valued Betti-numbers
entry.summary: In this paper we generalize the approximation theorem for L^2-Betti numbers to an approximation theorem for center-valued Betti-numbers.
entry.arxiv:comment: The second version has an additional section. It is section 4

entry.title: On multiplicative conditionally free convolution
entry.summary: Using the combinatorics of non-crossing partitions, we construct a conditionally free analogue of the Voiculescu's S-transform. The result is applied to analytical description of conditionally free multiplicative convolution and characterization of infinite divisibility.

entry.title: Unique mixing of the shift on the C*--algebras generated by the q--canonical commutation relations
entry.summary: The shift on the C^*--algebras generated by the Fock representation of the q--commutation relations has the strong ergodic property of unique mixing, when |q|<1.

entry.title: From subfactor planar algebras to subfactors
entry.summary: We present a purely planar algebraic proof of the main result of a paper of Guionnet-Jones-Shlaykhtenko which constructs an extremal subfactor from a subfactor planar algebra whose standard invariant is given by that planar algebra.

entry.title: An orthogonal approach to the subfactor of a planar algebra
entry.summary: By changing to an orthogonal basis, we give a short proof that the subfactor of the graded algebra of a planar algebra reproduces the planar algebra.

entry.title: A Kind of Compact Quantum Semigroups
entry.summary: We show that the quantum family of all maps from a finite space to a finite dimensional compact quantum semigroup has a canonical quantum semigroup structure.

entry.title: The relative commutant of separable C*-algebras of real rank zero
entry.summary: We answer a question of E. Kirchberg (personal communication): does the relative commutant of a separable C*-algebra in its ultrapower depend on the choice of the ultrafilter?
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Journal of Functional Analysis

entry.title: Duality of cones of positive maps
entry.summary: We study the so-called K-positive linear maps from B(L) into B(H) for finite dimensional Hilbert spaces L and H and give characterizations of the dual cone of the cone of K-positive maps. Applications are given to decomposable maps and PPT-states.

entry.title: Simplicity of finitely-aligned k-graph C*-algebras
entry.summary: It is shown that no local periodicity is equivalent to the aperiodicity condition for arbitrary finitely-aligned k-graphs. This allows us to conclude that C*(\Lambda) is simple if and only if \Lambda is cofinal and has no local periodicity.

entry.title: On concrete models for local operator spaces
entry.summary: In this short note, we propose a concrete analogue of the space $\cL(H)$ for local operator spaces, the multinormed $C^*$-algebra $\displaystyle\prod_{\alpha} \cL(H_{\alpha})$.

entry.title: Poisson boundary of the discrete quantum group A_u(F)^
entry.summary: We identify the Poisson boundary of the dual of the universal compact quantum group A_u(F) with a measurable field of ITPFI factors.

entry.title: Non-crossing linked partitions and multiplication of free random variables
entry.summary: The material gives a new combinatorial proof of the multiplicative property of the S-transform. In particular, several properties of the coefficients of its inverse are connected to non-crossing linked partitions and planar trees.

entry.title: Operator algebras: an informal overview
entry.summary: In this article we give a short and informal overview of some aspects of the theory of C*- and von Neumann algebras. We also mention some classical results and applications of these families of operator algebras.

entry.title: Z^2-actions on Kirchberg algebras
entry.summary: We classify a large class of Z^2-actions on the Kirchberg algebras employing the Kasparov group KK^1 as the space of classification invariants.

entry.title: Semigroups of Local Homeomorphisms
entry.summary: The paper submitted has been withdrawn for revision. Example 1 is incorrect; the map is not a local homeomorphism.

entry.title: Examples of masas in C*-algebras
entry.summary: This paper illustrates the notion of a Cartan subalgebra in a C*-algebra through a number of examples and counterexamples. Some of these examples have a geometrical flavour and are related to orbifolds and non-Hausdorff manifolds.

entry.title: E_0-dilation of pairs of quantized convolution semigroups
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, because a better treatment is given in the author's Phd. thesis (Sections 3.4.6 and 4.4), now available on the arxiv.

entry.title: Nuclear dimension and the corona factorization property
entry.summary: We show that stabilizations of sufficiently noncommutative separable unital C*-algebras with finite nuclear dimension have the corona factorization property.

entry.title: The C*-alegbras of the Heisenberg Group and of thread-like Lie groups
entry.summary: We describe the C*-algebras of the Heisenberg group H_n, n\geq 1, and the thread-like Lie group G_N, N\geq 3, in terms of C*-algebras of operator fields.

entry.title: New holomorphically closed subalgebras of $C^*$-algebras of hyperbolic groups
entry.summary: We construct dense, unconditional subalgebras of the reduced group $C^*$-algebra of a word-hyperbolic group, which are closed under holomorphic functional calculus and possess many bounded traces. Applications to the cyclic cohomology of group $C^*$-algebras and to delocalized $L^2$-invariants of negatively curved manifolds are given.

entry.title: Maharam traces on von Neumann algebras
entry.summary: Traces $\Phi$ on von Neumann algebras with values in complex order complete vector lattices are considered. The full description of these traces is given for the case when $\Phi$ is the Maharam trace. The version of Radon-Nikodym-type theorem for Maharam traces is established.

entry.title: Characterizing graph C*-correspondences
entry.summary: Every separable nondegenerate C*-correspondence over a commutative C*-algebra with discrete spectrum is isomorphic to a graph correspondence.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages; latex, uses pgf and tikz. Minor typos corrected

entry.title: Equivariant T-Duality of Locally Compact Abelian Groups
entry.summary: Equivariant T-duality triples of locally compact abelian groups are considered. The motivating example dealing with the group $\R^n$ containing a lattice $\Z^n$ comes with an isomorphism in twisted equivariant K-theory.

entry.title: A non-convex asymptotic quantum Horn body
entry.summary: We prove by a counterexample that asymptotic quantum Horn bodies are not convex in general.

entry.title: On a Question of D. Shlyakhtenko
entry.summary: In this short note we construct two countable, infinite conjugacy class groups which admit free, ergodic, probability measure preserving orbit equivalent actions, but whose group von Neumann algebras are not (stably) isomorphic.

entry.title: Non-K-exact uniform Roe C*-algebras
entry.summary: We prove that uniform Roe C*-algebras associated to some expander graphs coming from discrete groups with property (\tau) are not K-exact. In particular, we show that this is the case for the expander obtained as Cayley graphs of a sequence of alternating groups (with appropriately chosen generating sets).

entry.title: Vanishing of second cohomology for tensor products of typeII$_1$ von Neumann algebras
entry.summary: We show that the second cohomology group $H^2(M\overline\otimes N, M\overline\otimes N)$ is always zero for arbitrary type II$_1$ von Neumann algebras $M$ and $N$.

entry.title: Graphs and CCR algebras
entry.summary: I introduce yet another way to associate a C*-algebra to a graph and construct a simple nuclear C*-algebra that has irreducible representations both on a separable and a nonseparable Hilbert space.

entry.title: An inner amenable group whose von Neumann algebra does not have property Gamma
entry.summary: We construct inner amenable groups G with infinite conjugacy classes and such that the associated II_1 factor does not have property Gamma of Murray and von Neumann. This solves a problem posed by Effros in 1975.

entry.title: Infinite divisibility for additive conditionally monotone convolutions
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been combined with the paper "Conditionally monotone independence I: Independence, additive convolutions and related convolutions''

entry.title: A tensor product of representations of UHF algebras arising from Kronecker products
entry.summary: We introduce a non-symmetric tensor product of representations of UHF algebras by using Kronecker products of matrices. We prove tensor product formulae of GNS representations by product states and show examples.

entry.title: The planar algebra of a fixed point subfactor
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to several mistakes and unclarities.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to several mistakes and unclarities.

entry.title: Maximal rank of extremal marginal tracial states
entry.summary: States on coupled quantum system whose restrictions to each subsystems are normalized traces are called marginal tracial states. We investigate extremal marginal tracial states and maximal rank of such states. Diagonal marginal tracial states are also considered.

entry.title: Unitary equivalence of representations of graph algebras and branching systems
entry.summary: In this paper we show that, for a class of countable graphs, every representation of the associated graph algebra in a separable Hilbert space is unitarily equivalent to a representation obtained via branching systems.

entry.title: On Affine Orbifold Nets Associated with Outer Automorphisms
entry.summary: We construct solitons in affine orbifold nets associated with outer automorphisms, and we show that our construction gives all the twisted representations of the fixed point subnet. This allows us to settle a number of questions concerning such orbifold constructions.

entry.title: Free Infinite Divisibility for Q-Gaussians
entry.summary: We prove that the q-Gaussian distribution introduced by Bozejko and Speicher is freely infinitely divisible for all q between zero and one.

entry.title: Lidskii-type formulae for Dixmier traces
entry.summary: We establish several analogues of the classical Lidskii Theorem for some special classes of singular traces (Dixmier traces and Connes-Dixmier traces) used in noncommutative geometry.

entry.title: Subfactors and Connes fusion for twisted loop groups
entry.summary: In this announcement we explain how to extend the von Neumann algebra definition of fusion to the case of twisted loop groups. This project completes research started by my student Robert Verrill in his 2001 Cambridge Ph.D. thesis.

entry.title: Inductive limit violates quasi-cocommutativity
entry.summary: We show that the inductive limit of a certain inductive system of quasi-cocommutative C$^{*}$-bialgebras is not quasi-cocommutative. This implies that the category of quasi-cocommutative C$^{*}$-bialgebras is not closed with respect to the inductive limit.

entry.title: Universal skein theory for finite depth subfactor planar algebras
entry.summary: We describe an explicit finite presentation for a finite depth subfactor planar algebra. We also show that such planar algebras are singly generated with the generator subject to finitely many relations.

entry.title: Subalgebras of $C(Î©,M_n)$ and their modules
entry.summary: We give an operator space characterization of subalgebras of $C(\Omega,M_n)$. We also describe injective subspaces of $C(\Omega,M_n)$ and then give applications to sub-TROs of $C(\Omega,M_n)$. Finally, we prove an `$n$-minimal version' of the Christensen-Effros-Sinclair representation theorem.

entry.title: A note on generators for finite depth subfactor planar algebras
entry.summary: We show that a subfactor planar algebra of finite depth $k$ is generated by a single $s$-box, for $s \leq min\{k+4,2k\}$.

entry.title: Semi-invertible extensions of C*-algebras
entry.summary: We prolonge the list of C*-algebras for which all extensions by any stable separable C*-algebra are semi-invertible. In particular, we handle certain amalgamations, both of C*-algebras and of groups. Concerning groups we consider both reduced and full group C*-algebras.

entry.title: Spectral morphisms, K-theory, and stable ranks
entry.summary: We give a brief account of the interplay between spectral morphisms, K-theory, and stable ranks in the context of Banach algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages; to appear in the Proceedings of the Workshop on Noncommutative Geometry (Fields Institute, Toronto 2008)

entry.title: Unbounded multipliers on operator spaces
entry.summary: We introduce unbounded multipliers on operator spaces. These multipliers generalize both, regular operators on Hilbert C*-modules and (bounded) multipliers on operator spaces.

entry.title: C*-algebras whose every C*-subalgebra is AF
entry.summary: Let $A$ be a $C^*$-algebra. It is shown that the following conditions are equinvalent: (1) $A$ is scattered, (2) every $C^*$-subalgebra of $A$ is AF, (3) every $C^*$-subalgebra of $A$ has real rank zero.

entry.title: Morita Equivalence of C^*-Crossed Products by Inverse Semigroup Actions and Partial Actions
entry.summary: Morita equivalence of twisted inverse semigroup actions and discrete twisted partial actions are introduced. Morita equivalent actions have Morita equivalent crossed products.

entry.title: Introduction to Normed *-Algebras and their Representations, 7th ed
entry.summary: This book treats: - spectral theory of Banach *-algebras, - basic representation theory of normed *-algebras, - spectral theory of representations of commutative *-algebras. A novel feature of the book is the construction of the enveloping C*-algebra of a general normed *-algebra.

entry.title: A note on the von Neumann algebra of a Baumslag-Solitar group
entry.summary: We study qualitative properties of the group von Neumann algebra of a Baumslag-Solitar group. Namely, we prove that, in the non-amenable and {ICC} case, the associated ${\rm II}_1$ factor is prime, not solid, and does not have any Cartan subalgebra.

entry.title: Factoriality, type classification and fullness for free product von Neumann algebras
entry.summary: We give a complete answer to the questions of factoriality, type classification and fullness for arbitrary free product von Neumann algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages; to appear in Adv. Math

entry.title: A classification of inductive limits of splitting interval algebras
entry.summary: It is shown that the Cuntz semigroup is a complete invariant for the C*-algebras that can be realized as an inductive limit of a sequence of finite direct sums of splitting interval algebras.

entry.title: Quasi-free actions of finite groups on the Cuntz algebra $\mathcal{O}_\infty$
entry.summary: We show that any faithful quasi-free actions of a finite group on the Cuntz algebra $\mathcal{O}_\infty$ are mutually conjugate, and that they are asymptotically representable.

entry.title: A Fock Space Model for Addition and Multiplication of C-free Random Variables
entry.summary: The paper presents a Fock space model suitable for constructions of c-free algebras. Immediate applications are direct proofs for the properties of the c-free R- and S-transforms.

entry.title: On characterization of integrable sesquilinear forms
entry.summary: We give necessary and sufficient condition for a sesquilinear form to be integrable with respect to a faithful normal state on a von Neumann algebra.

entry.title: Weighted monotonicity inequalities for unbounded operators
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial sign error in equation 1.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Tensor products of positive maps of matrix algebras
entry.summary: We give conditions for when the tensor product of two positive maps between matrix algebras is a positive map. This happens when one map belongs to a symmetric mapping cone and the other to the dual cone. Necessary and sufficient conditions are given.

entry.title: On type III_1 factors arising as free products
entry.summary: Type III_1 factors arising as (direct summands of) von Neumann algebraic free products are investigated. In particular we compute Connes' Sd- and tau- invariants for those type III_1 factors without any extra assumption.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, "almost" final version; to appear in Math. Res. Lett
